description.zh-cn: 中国古代建设并使用至今的大型水利工程，位于四川省都江堰市城西。由鱼嘴、飞沙堰、宝瓶口等主体工程构成，主要作用是引水灌溉和防洪。
description.en: A large-scale hydraulic engineering project built in ancient China and still in use today, located west of Dujiangyan City, Sichuan Province. It consists of main structures such as the Yuzui, Feishayan, and Baopingkou, with its primary functions being water diversion for irrigation and flood control.

description.zh-cn: 战国时期秦国蜀郡郡守，主持修建了都江堰。
description.en: The governor of Shu Commandery in the State of Qin during the Warring States period, who presided over the construction of Dujiangyan.

description.zh-cn: 李冰的儿子，与其父共同修建都江堰。
description.en: The son of Li Bing, who jointly constructed the Dujiangyan with his father.

description.zh-cn: 古蜀国君主。有说法认为他“决玉垒山以除水害”，开凿了宝瓶口，是都江堰的早期建设者。
description.en: A king of the ancient Shu kingdom. According to some accounts, he 'cut through Mount Yulei to eliminate water hazards' by excavating the Baopingkou, making him an early builder of Dujiangyan.

description.zh-cn: 中国战国时期的一个诸侯国，李冰在此期间担任蜀郡郡守。
description.en: A vassal state during the Warring States period of China, during which Li Bing served as the governor of Shu Commandery.

description.zh-cn: 秦国设立的一个郡，位于今四川省境内。
description.en: A commandery established by the State of Qin, located in present-day Sichuan Province.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代官职，为一个郡的最高行政长官。
description.en: An official title in ancient China, the highest administrative officer of a commandery.

description.zh-cn: 位于四川盆地西部，是都江堰工程的主要灌溉区域，被称为“天府之国”。
description.en: Located in the western part of the Sichuan Basin, it is the main irrigation area of the Dujiangyan project, known as the 'Land of Abundance'.

description.zh-cn: 蜀汉丞相，曾于228年征集兵丁守护都江堰，并设立专职堰官进行管理。
description.en: Chancellor of Shu Han who, in 228, conscripted soldiers to guard Dujiangyan and established specialized weir officials for its management.

description.zh-cn: 元朝四川肃政谦访使，于1335年主持大修，首次引入铁石结构改造都江堰。
description.en: A Surveillance Commissioner of Sichuan during the Yuan dynasty who, in 1335, presided over a major overhaul and first introduced an iron-and-stone structure to renovate Dujiangyan.

description.zh-cn: 清朝四川总督，于1877年参考明代方法，以铁石结构改造了都江堰的堰体和堤坝。
description.en: Governor-General of Sichuan during the Qing dynasty who, in 1877, renovated the weirs and dams of Dujiangyan with an iron-and-stone structure, referencing Ming dynasty methods.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期四川省水利局长，于1936年主持都江堰大修，采用近代设计施工方法和水泥等新材料，奠定了现代鱼嘴的基础。
description.en: Director of the Sichuan Provincial Water Conservancy Bureau during the Republic of China era who, in 1936, presided over a major overhaul of Dujiangyan using modern design, construction methods, and new materials like cement, laying the foundation for the modern Yuzui.

description.zh-cn: 2008年发生于中国四川的特大地震，对都江堰及二王庙造成了损害。
description.en: A catastrophic earthquake that occurred in Sichuan, China in 2008, causing damage to Dujiangyan and the Erwang Temple.

description.zh-cn: 位于都江堰玉垒山麓，是为纪念李冰父子而修建的祀庙。在汶川大地震中全部垮塌后重建。
description.en: Located at the foot of Mount Yulei in Dujiangyan, it is a temple built to commemorate Li Bing and his son. It was rebuilt after completely collapsing in the Wenchuan earthquake.

description.zh-cn: 1933年发生于岷江上游的地震，导致的山体滑坡形成堰塞湖，其后溃坝形成的洪水将都江堰堰首建筑全部冲毁。
description.en: An earthquake that occurred in the upper reaches of the Min River in 1933, causing landslides that formed a barrier lake. The subsequent dam failure unleashed a flood that completely destroyed the headworks of Dujiangyan.

description.zh-cn: 1981年四川发生的特大洪水，导致都江堰灌区的水利设施受到不同程度的破坏。
description.en: A major flood in Sichuan in 1981 that caused varying degrees of damage to the water conservancy facilities in the Dujiangyan irrigation area.

description.zh-cn: 经济学家，在1979至1980年间参观都江堰后深受震撼，立志要像李冰父子那样，为后世子孙的幸福贡献力量。
description.en: An economist who, after visiting Dujiangyan between 1979 and 1980, was profoundly moved and vowed to contribute to the happiness of future generations, just like Li Bing and his son.

description.zh-cn: 李冰主持修建了都江堰水利工程。
description.en: Li Bing presided over the construction of the Dujiangyan irrigation system.

description.zh-cn: 李冰之子协助其父修建了都江堰水利工程。
description.en: The son of Li Bing assisted his father in the construction of the Dujiangyan irrigation system.

description.zh-cn: 李冰之子是李冰的儿子。
description.en: The son of Li Bing is the son of Li Bing.

description.zh-cn: 根据一种说法，古蜀国君主开明“决玉垒山以除水害”，开凿了宝瓶口，是都江堰的早期建设者。
description.en: According to one theory, Kaiming, the king of the ancient Shu kingdom, 'cut through Mount Yulei to eliminate water hazards' by excavating the Baopingkou, making him an early builder of Dujiangyan.

description.zh-cn: 李冰在秦国担任蜀郡郡守期间修建了都江堰。
description.en: Li Bing constructed Dujiangyan during his tenure as the Governor of Shu Commandery for the State of Qin.

description.zh-cn: 蜀郡是秦国下辖的一个郡。
description.en: Shu Commandery was a commandery under the jurisdiction of the State of Qin.

description.zh-cn: 都江堰工程通过引水灌溉和防洪，将成都平原变成了“水旱从人，不知饥馑”的“天府之国”。
description.en: Through water diversion for irrigation and flood control, the Dujiangyan project transformed the Chengdu Plain into the 'Land of Abundance', where 'droughts and floods are controlled by man, and famine is unknown'.

description.zh-cn: 诸葛亮于228年征集兵丁守护都江堰，并设立专职堰官进行管理，保障了工程的持续运作。
description.en: In 228, Zhuge Liang conscripted soldiers to guard Dujiangyan and established specialized weir officials for its management, ensuring the continued operation of the project.

description.zh-cn: 吉当普主持大修，首次引入锚铁浆砌条石结构代替传统的竹笼卵石结构，对都江堰进行了重大的技术革新。
description.en: Ji Dangpu presided over a major overhaul, introducing for the first time an iron-anchored, stone-and-mortar structure to replace the traditional gabions, marking a significant technological innovation for Dujiangyan.

description.zh-cn: 丁宝桢以铁石结构改造了都江堰的堰体和堤坝，提升了其稳固性。
description.en: Ding Baozhen renovated the weirs and dams of Dujiangyan with an iron-and-stone structure, enhancing its stability.

description.zh-cn: 张沅主持的1936年大修采用了近代设计和施工方法，并使用水泥等新材料，奠定了现代都江堰的基础。
description.en: The 1936 major overhaul led by Zhang Yuan employed modern design and construction methods, using new materials like cement, which laid the foundation for the modern Dujiangyan.

description.zh-cn: 汶川大地震导致都江堰的鱼嘴部分出现开裂，对工程造成了损害。
description.en: The Wenchuan earthquake caused cracking in the Yuzui section of Dujiangyan, damaging the project.

description.zh-cn: 二王庙的古建筑群在汶川大地震中全部垮塌。
description.en: The ancient building complex of Erwang Temple completely collapsed during the Wenchuan earthquake.

description.zh-cn: 1933年叠溪大地震导致的堰塞湖溃坝，其形成的洪水将都江堰堰首建筑全部冲毁。
description.en: The failure of a barrier lake formed by the 1933 Diexi earthquake unleashed a flood that completely destroyed the headworks of Dujiangyan.

description.zh-cn: 1981年的特大洪水中，都江堰灌区的水利设施受到不同程度的破坏。
description.en: During the major flood of 1981, the water conservancy facilities in the Dujiangyan irrigation area suffered varying degrees of damage.

description.zh-cn: 林毅夫在参观都江堰后深受其跨越千年的功绩震撼，这激发了他立志为后世子孙的幸福贡献力量的决心。
description.en: After visiting Dujiangyan, Justin Yifu Lin was profoundly moved by its millennial achievements, which inspired his resolve to contribute to the happiness of future generations.
